properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 8:25PM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW SHIFTING INTO IDAHO AND FAR NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...

.Snow is tapering off in the Spokane Area and on the Palouse but remains
moderate to heavy in areas of the Idaho Panhandle and far northeastern
reaches of Washington.  Light to moderate snow showers also continue
along the Cascade Crest.  Another disturbance will move into the
region overnight with light snow showers returning to most locations
across Eastern Washington and North Idaho.  Additional accumulations
of 1 to 3 inches will be possible with locally higher amounts with this
second wave into Saturday..

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8
inches. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph.

* WHERE...Hayden, Worley, Coeur D Alene, Harrison.

* WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility and result in local areas of
drifting snow. The hazardous conditions could impact the
morning commute and will impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING
